strats.name: No-Tank Dachora Escape
note: A spark cuts off with 29 energy remaining.
It's possible to get out with one E-Tank without hjb, but it's very difficult.
It's also not possible to get to the ceiling with that spark so we can't really model it.
We'll limit this to the hjb version, where reaching the ceiling with no E_Tank is essentially doable (if tricky).

obstacles.name: Top Bomb Block
obstacles.note: The Bomb block that blocks the save room

obstacles.name: Mid Power Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: The Power Bomb Blocks that block Mission Impossible access

obstacles.name: Crumble Blocks
obstacles.note: The Crumble Blocks that serve as an escape for the top Mission Impossible door

obstacles.note: The Bomb blocks that separate Charge Beam from the main section

obstacles.name: Bottom Power Bomb Block

obstacles.name: Spore Spawn Escape Barrier
obstacles.note: It's two bomb blocks and a Super block

to.note: FIXME There's a speedball strat here to clear the obstacle, depending on adjacent room

strats.name: Big Pink Left-Side X-Ray Climb
note: Normally, an XRayClimb's resetRoom has mustStayPut true, but because node 5 is configured to spawn at 14, Samus will be expected to visit 14 before 5 when setting up.
It's also possible to X-Ray Climb to 13, but that's reachable for free just by falling down the crumble blocks anyway.

to.note: FIXME Obstacle can be broken with a speedball coming in from 2, but can't be done with too short a charge as you won't clear the gap

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Can only be done if the crumble blocks have been broken beforehand.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This base strat represents only backtracking after entering from 7.

obstacles.note: CF to force a standup, making it possible to shoot the super block from the left while it's on-screen.

strats.name: Retroactive X-Ray Setup
strats.note: The only expected way for Samus to access 5 is to enter room while doing a stationary spinjump, otherwise she is expected to spawn at 14 and fall to 13.

nodes.name: Power Bomb (pink Brinstar)
Mission Impossible Top Left Junction
nodes.note: The top left section of the room, where the Super block is

strats.name: Tank the Damage
note: 2 hits are expected to be taken.
First hit can be either from a Sidehopper or from a spike.
Second hit will be from a Sidehopper.

obstacles.note: Morph reduces damage because the ceiling Sidehopper can't reach a morphed Samus.

strats.name: Intermediate Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Charge here is for Pseudo Screw kills.

strats.name: Morph Intermediate Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Morph reduces damage because the ceiling Sidehopper can't reach a morphed Samus.

strats.name: Safe Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: All beam weapons that can take out a Sidehopper in 5 hits or less can reliably take out the Sidehoppers damage-free.

strats.name: Mission Impossible

failures.name: Crumble Failure
failures.note: Failure leaves you at 3 with a solid crumble block above.

note: This involves doing a quick-drop through the Crumble block, grabbing the item, and jumping back up before the crumble block reappears.
Mission Impossible expects that the Sidehoppers are dead. To avoid redundant requirements, they must be killed coming in.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: To avoid redundant requirements, obstacle must be destroyed coming in.

nodes.name: Pink Brinstar Hoppers Junction (Cleared Bottom Left)
nodes.note: This junction is essentially equivalent to being near the left door but with the enemies cleared

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The reverse GGG pretty much requires you to clear the enemies, so it's done from node 3.

strats.name: Power Beam Kill
note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.
The Small Sidehoppers may deliver more of the hits, but this is an assumed worst case scenario

strats.name: Intermediate Weapon Kill
strats.note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.

strats.name: Fast Weapon Kill
strats.note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.

strats.name: Power Beam Kill
strats.note: The Small Sidehoppers may deliver more of the hits, but this is an assumed worst case scenario

strats.name: Fast Weapon Kill
strats.note: Expects an intentional Small Sidehopper hit for iframes.

strats.name: Safe Kill
strats.note: With access to the right side of the room, it's possible to kill the enemies safely with Wave or a PB

strats.name: Pink Brin Reverse GGG
note: This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
ITs acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.
The reverse GGG pretty much requires killing the enemies first, so it's done here rather than at node 1.
